entries.content: Price objections often stem from the salesperson's inability to demonstrate or get the prospect to see value.
Selling effectively requires getting the prospect to see and understand the value of your solution.
Avoid competitive/value issues by targeting the right audience where your value proposition resonates naturally (e.g., Harrods don't leaflet the Council Estate).
Understand precisely what problems your solution fixes and how they manifest for the prospect.
Prospects will talk to you if you can fix a problem on their mind, regardless of personality or competitors.
Frame value honestly: 'I don't know if I can fix this for you, but I have helped people like you in similar circumstances.'
Ask questions like 'How does that make you feel?' to move prospects from intellect to emotion, highlighting the pain your solution alleviates.

focus_area: Competitive Objections: Unique value framing without attacking others
